rrpss

Class OrderManager

  • Object
    • OrderManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class OrderManager
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Stores all Order objects of the whole restaurants and provides ways to creating new Order and getting existing Order object.

    Basically, this class is the "manager" of a Restaurant whose main job is to manage all things related to Order creation.

    This class implements the Serializable interface as this object may be saved into a ".ser" file during the application execution.

    Author:
    Edwin Candinegara
    See Also:
    Serializable, Serialized Form

      An integer keeping track of the Order object ID in order to avoid having an Order object with the same ID as an existing Order object.
      private Vector<Order> orders

    • Field Detail

      • orders

        private Vector<Order> orders
        A Vector object which stores all Order objects of a Restaurant

      • idCounter

        private int idCounter
        An integer keeping track of the Order object ID in order to avoid having an Order object with the same ID as an existing Order object. This integer will be used when a new Order object is created which is done by calling createOrder(Calendar, Staff).

        Initially, the value of this integer is 1.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrderManager

        public OrderManager()
        Constructs an OrderManager object and initially it has no Order object at all.

    • Method Detail

      • createOrder

        public Order createOrder(Calendar dateTime,
                Staff staff)
        Creates a new Order object with no menu items at all initially. Inside this method, the idCounter is assigned to the new Order object's ID attribute and idCounter is then incremented.

        Return the created Order object to the caller.

        Parameters:
        dateTime - A Calendar object indicating the date and time when an Order object is created
        staff - A Staff object indicating which Staff creates the Order object
        Returns:
        An Order object storing the dateTime and staff argument.

      • getOrderById

        public Order getOrderById(int orderId)
        Returns the Order object with the specified ID attribute. If no such Order object is found, return null.
        Parameters:
        orderId - The ID of the Order object (should be an ID of an existing AlaCarte object)
        Returns:
        The Order object which has the same ID as orderId
